title: In ARAM you always get the same champion and sometimes champions in your team are not very good.
body: I don't know if it only happened on me that I never get some champions when I playing ARAM and always get these same champions. I mean I want try some different champions so I'm going to play ARAM. Usually get these guys: {{champion:78}} {{champion:33}} {{champion:16}} {{champion:92}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:75}} {{champion:19}} Also sometimes the team is not very good. For example in your team you don't have any adc but the other team have 3 adc that is ridiculous.

replies.body:
ARAM stands for All **Random** All Mid. It looks like don't quite own all of the champions, so it's going to be picking from the weekly rotation and those that you *do* own. 

Also, you won't always have a proper team (tank/adc/mid/support/jungle) when playing ARAM, also due to the fact that the picks are random.
The correct term is A(All owned champions) R(Randomly Selected) A(ALL) M(Mid) or ARAM if it was True ARAM your statement would be correct.

Pretty sure the intent behind the name is/was simply All (players) Random All (players) Mid. Because everyone would hit "random" and then everyone would go mid.

Whether or not ARAM should have all champs enabled is a separate discussion, and the name of the mode has little relevance to that discussion. Hell, Summoner's Rift is still called Summoner's Rift despite summoners being removed from the lore years ago.
